title: Shamed boobgate rant cop has been 'sidelined' with a move to Oldham
text:

A shamed senior police officer who bared her breast at the height of an hour-long drunken rant against a junior colleague over her ‘boob job’ is now working with Oldham Council. 
In November Rebekah Sutcliffe was handed a final written warning after she was found guilty of gross misconduct for behaving ‘shockingly, cruelly and hurtfully’ to Superintendent Sarah Jackson during a boozy gala dinner at Manchester’s Hilton Hotel. 
Now the M.E.N. has learned that the £109,000-a-year assistant chief constable, whose portfolio had included serious crime and counter terrorism, has been quietly sidelined. Read More GMP to close public counters at ten police stations 
She has been seconded to Oldham Council where she is is overseeing a project to encourage police and other public bodies to work more closely together. 
Severely drunk ACC Sutcliffe, a vicar’s daughter from Saddleworth and one of the most senior female officers in the country, had pulled down her dress to reveal her left breast during an hour-long rant at her ‘silly and vain’ junior over her ‘boob job’, telling the object of her ire: “Look at these. Look at these. These are the breasts of someone who has had three children. They are ugly but I don’t feel the need to pump myself full of silicone to get self-esteem.” 
One GMP insider told the M.E.N: “She has effectively been sidelined. It’s a well-worn path for GMP officers whose faces no longer fit to work on projects like this. It’s a huge come down from what she was before all this.” 
Both force leaders and junior officer were dismayed when the eminent, independent disciplinary panel - having found her guilty of gross misconduct - recommended that GMP should spare her from the sack. Read More Police of all ranks in GMP are furious that 'boobgate' ACC Rebekah Sutcliffe is set to keep her job 
New rules on disciplinary hearings for the most senior police officers required the panel which heard a case to make a recommendation, which Deputy Chief Constable Ian Pilling felt obliged to accept. 
A statement from GMP said: “Assistant Chief Constable Rebekah Sutcliffe is working with Oldham Council. It is an important role overseeing the introduction of integrated working across the public sector and the learning will be shared more widely. Rebekah has extensive knowledge and experience of work considering public sector reform. The project is for an initial six months.” Like us on Facebook
